item.title: Pervez Musharraf's movement confined to 2 rooms of his farmhouse:aide
item.description: Pervez Musharraf has been restricted to two rooms and his family is not permitted to meet him.

item.title: Obama holds Situation Room meeting on Boston bomb blasts
item.description: The meeting lasted for about 90 minutes and was held to review the events in Boston.

item.title: China hits back at US in annual human rights survey
item.description: China accuses US of spying on its own citizens, discriminating against women and ethnic minorities.

item.title: Kashmir issue finds no mention in poll campaigns in Pakistan
item.description: The country goes to polls on May 11 to elect 272 members in a house of 342.

item.title: Boston suspect caught, focus shifts to brother's Chechnya visit
item.description: Dzhokhar was hospitalised in a serious condition, unable to be questioned about his motives

item.title: Teenager at home in US, swayed by elder brother who wasn't
item.description: San, a former classmate at the university, said he would be willing to testify on Dzhokhar''s behalf

item.title: 12 dead, 15 missing in Brazil boat accident
item.description: The boat carrying more than 70 passengers sailed from Marajo island to Belem.

item.title: Media, old and new, takes heat for Boston coverage
item.description: Authorities were actually seeking two brothers, with no link to the missing student.

item.title: Singapore hit by bomb hoaxes after Boston attacks
item.description: Preliminary investigations indicated that the suspect had no intention or means to carry out his threats.

item.title: Pakistan SC forms bench to hear treason case against Pervez Musharraf
item.description: Information Minister Arif Nizami, said the government is likely to submit a reply on Monday.
